greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that k+1 and k^2+1 are primes.
comment: For any n > 1 in this sequence, (n+1)*(n^2+1) has the same nonzero digits as its prime factors in base n. - _Ely Golden_, Dec 12 2016
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from Zak Seidov)
program: (PARI) list(lim)=my(v=List()); forprime(p=2,lim+1, if(isprime(1+(p-1)^2), listput(v,p-1))); Vec(v) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 13 2016
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 13 2002
